intro: Babiana rosea, commonly known as the red babiana, is a striking South African bulbous plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a cluster of showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Babiana rosea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
